div.h2: School District of Holmen Is Closed Starting 3/16/...

div.div:
School District of Holmen Is Closed Starting 3/16/2020
The School District of Holmen will be closed March until further notice. For more information visit the Community tab of the District website. Early Childhood and 4K instruction, as well as all sports/extra-curricular activities scheduled for that period in District facilities are also cancelled. Click here for more information regarding emergency school cancellations, including a list of media outlets the School District of Holmen will update if there are further changes.

span.a: You are currently on this page - COVID-19
You are currently on this page - COVID-19

td.h3: School District of Holmen Closure Resources

p.em: (Lunches are available Monday, Wednesday, and Friday. Click here for more information.)

td.p: Due to Governor Evers "Safer at Home" order issued March 23, Holmen Nutrition Services will offer our community (18 years of age and younger) bagged lunches on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays at Holmen Middle School beginning March 25.

Bagged lunches will no longer be provided on Tuesdays and Thursdays, but we will continue to offer students meals for two days at each pick up, so they are covered for days when lunches are not offered. In addition, lunches will no longer be provided at Sand Lake Elementary effective immediately. Lunches will not be provided at Holmen High School starting March 25, 2020. Lunches will continue to be available at Holmen Middle School.

ul.li: Complete the Bagged Lunch Order Form at any time.
Call (608)526-1325, 8:00-10:00 a.m. (Do not leave a voicemail for meal ordering. Please speak with the attendant.) or calling
Orders placed after 11:00 a.m. processed for the next service day.
Pickup is available from 11:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. at Holmen Middle School on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays.

p.span: Seeking technical assistance related to online learning? Need help troubleshooting a District-provided Chromebook? The School District of Holmen technology helpdesk remains available during the school closure.

Call 608-526-1367 on weekdays to speak with someone who can answer your technology questions, schedule an appointment for Chromebook repair, or direct advanced questions to the appropriate member of the I&T team. Students can also email ithelpdesk@holmen.k12.wi.us from their school email accounts.

hr.p: Click here for a list of local food pantries.

Because of the current situation of COVID-19, the United States Department of Education announced flexibility with state testing. Therefore, the Wisconsin Department of Public Instruction has suspended state testing for the 2019-2020 school year. This includes the Wisconsin Forward Exam for grades 3-8 and 10, the ACT Aspire Exam for grades 9 and 10, and the Dynamic Learning Exam for our special needs population.
